sentences.text: Notice of 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Wednesday, May 3, 2017 10:00 a.m., Eastern Daylight Time GIANT Center
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: he 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders (the Annual Meeting) of The Hershey Company (the Company) will be held on Wednesday, May 3, 2017, beginning at 10:00 a.m., Eastern Daylight Time, at GIANT enter, 550 West Hersheypark Drive, Hershey, Pennsylvania.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purposes of the meeting are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. To elect the 12 nominees named in the Proxy Statement to serve as directors of the Company until the 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. To ratify the appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as the Companys independent auditors for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. To conduct an advisory vote regarding the compensation of the Companys named executive officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. To conduct an advisory vote regarding the frequency of future advisory votes on named executive officer compensation; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. To discuss and take action on any other business that is properly brought before the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: he Proxy Statement accompanying this Notice of 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders describes each of these items in detail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Proxy Statement contains other important information that you should read and onsider before you vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors of the Company has established the close of business on March 6, 2017 as the record date for determining the stockholders who are entitled to notice of, and to vote at, the Annual Meeting and any adjournment or postponement thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company is furnishing proxy materials to its stockholders through the Internet as permitted under the rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under these rules, many of the Companys stockholders will receive a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials instead of a paper copy of the Notice of 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders and Proxy Statement, our proxy card, and our Annual Report on Form 10-K.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this process gives us the opportunity to serve you more efficiently by making the proxy materials available quickly online and reducing costs associated with printing and postage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders who do not receive a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials will receive a paper copy of the proxy materials by mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leslie M. Turner Senior Vice President, General Counsel and Secretar
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: March 23, 2017

sentences.text: Your vote is important.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instructions on how to vote are contained in our Proxy Statement and in the Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please cast your vote by telephone or over the Internet as described in those materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alternatively, if you requested a copy of the proxy/voting instruction card by mail, you may mark, sign, date and return the proxy/voting instruction card in the envelope provided.

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION HIGHLIGHTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program is intended to provide competitive compensation based on performance and contributions to the Company, to incentivize, attract and retain key executives, to align the interests of our executive officers and our stockholders and to drive stockholder value over the long term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To achieve these objectives, our executive compensation program includes the following key features:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We Pay for Performance by aligning our short- and long-term incentive compensation plans with business strategies to reward executives who achieve or exceed applicable Company and business division goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, approximately 70% of the target total direct compensation for our Chief Executive Officer (CEO) and, on average, 60% of the target total direct compensation for our oth named executive officers (NEOs) was variable and tied to Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts under our annual cash incentive program for 2016 were 100% performance based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 50% of the equity awards granted to our NEOs in 2016 took the form of performance stock units, which will be earned based on achievement of pre-determined performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 25% of the equity awards granted to our NEOs in 2016 took the form of stock options, which will only have value to our NEOs to the extent our stock price increases over the long term
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We Pay Competitively by targeting total cash compensation and total direct compensation for each of our NEOs around the 50th percentile of our defined market for talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We regularly review and, as appropriate, make changes to our peer group to ensure it is representative of our market for talent, our business portfolio, our overall size and our glo footprint.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not provide excessive benefits and perquisites to our executives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We Align Our Compensation Program with Stockholder Interests by providing a significant amount of each NEOs compensation opportunity in the form of equity and requiring executive stock
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity grants represented 65% of our CEOs 2016 target total direct compensation and, on average, 52% of the 2016 target total direct compensation for our other NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock ownership requirements for our NEOs range from 5x salary (for our CEO) to 3x salary (for NEOs other than our CEO).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO Target Total Direct Compensation for 2016   Compensation Element   % of Total      Description   Cash      Equity      Salary   14   Fixed annual cash amount           Annual Cash Incentive   21   Variable annual cash payment           Long-Term Incentive   65   Equity awards with 3-4 year vest periods
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors (the Board) of The Hershey Company (the Company, we, or us) is furnishing this Proxy Statement and the accompanying form of proxy in connection with the solicitation of proxies for the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders of the Company (the Annual Meeting).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Meeting will be held on May 3, 2017, beginning at 10:00 a.m., Eastern Daylight Time (EDT), at GIANT Center, 550 West Hersheypark Drive, Hershey, Pennsylvania 17033.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: mportant Notice Regarding the Availability of Proxy Materials for the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders to be held on May 3, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice of 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders and Proxy Statement, our proxy card, our Annual Report on Form 10-K and other annual meeting materials are available free of charge on the Internet at www.proxyvote.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We intend to begin mailing our Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials to stockholders on or about March 23, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At that time, we also will begin mailing paper copies of our proxy materials to stockholders who requested them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS ABOUT THE ANNUAL MEETING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: Who is entitled to attend and vote at the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: You can attend and vote at the Annual Meeting if, as of the close of business on March 6, 2017 (the Record Date), you were a stockholder of record of the Companys common stock (Common Stock) or Class B common stock (Class B Common Stock).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the Record Date, there were 152,069,763 shares of our Common Stock and 60,619,777 shares of our Class B Common Stock outstanding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: How do I gain admission to the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: If you are a registered stockholder, you must bring with you the Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials and a government-issued photo identification (such as a valid drivers license or passport) to gain admission to the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you did not receive a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials because you elected to receive a paper copy of the proxy materials, please bring the admission ticket printed on the top half of the proxy card supplied with those materials, together with your government-issued photo identification.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you receive your proxy materials by email, please call our Investor Relations Department at (800) 539-0261 and request an admission ticket for the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold your shares in street name and want to attend the Annual Meeting, you must bring your government-issued photo identification, together with
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials you received from your broker, bank or other holder of record; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A letter from your broker, bank or other holder of record indicating that you were the beneficial owner of Company stock as of the Record Date; o
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your most recent account statement indicating that you were the beneficial owner of Company stock as of the Record Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: What is the difference between a registered stockholder and a stockholder who owns stock in street name?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: If you hold shares of Common Stock or Class B Common Stock directly in your name on the books of the Companys transfer agent, you are a registered stockholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you own your Company shares indirectly through a broker, bank or other holder of record, then you are a beneficial owner and those shares are held in street name.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: What are the voting rights of each class of stock?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: Stockholders are entitled to cast one vote for each share of Common Stock held as of the Record Date, and 10 votes for each share of Class B Common Stock held as of the Record Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are no cumulative voting rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: Can I vote my shares before the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: Yes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a registered stockholder, there are three ways to vote your shares before the Annual Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Internet (www.proxyvote.com)  Use the Internet to transmit your voting instructions until 11:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EDT on May 2, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Have your Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials or proxy card available and follow the instructions on the website to vote your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By telephone (800-690-6903)  Submit your vote by telephone until 11:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EDT on May 2, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Have your Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials or proxy card available and follow the instructions provided by the recorded message to vote your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By mail  If you received a paper copy of the proxy materials, you can vote by mail by filling out the proxy card enclosed with those materials and returning it pursuant to the instructions set forth on the card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be valid, proxy cards must be received before the start of the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held in street name, your broker, bank or other holder of record may provide you with a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials that contains instructions on how to access our prox materials and vote online or to request a paper or email copy of our proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received these materials in paper form, the materials included a voting instruction card so you can instruct your broker, bank or other holder of record how to vote your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please see the Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials or the information your bank, broker or other holder of record provided you for more information on these voting options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: Can I vote in person at the Annual Meeting instead of by proxy?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: If you are a registered stockholder, you can vote at the Annual Meeting any shares that were registered in your name as the stockholder of record as of the Record Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held in street name, you cannot vote those shares at the Annual Meeting unless you have a legal proxy from the holder of record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you plan to attend and vote your street-name shares at the Annual Meeting, you should request a legal proxy from your broker, bank or other holder of record and bring it with you to the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you plan to vote at the Annual Meeting, please pick up a ballot at the designated voting booth upon your arrival.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may then either deposit your ballot in any of the designated ballot boxes located inside the meeting room before the meeting begins or submit your ballot to a meeting usher at the time designated during the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ballots will not be distributed during the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares may not be voted after the polls close.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether or not you plan to attend the Annual Meeting, we strongly encourage you to vote your shares by proxy prior to the Annual Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: Can I revoke my proxy or change my voting instructions once submitted?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a registered stockholder, you can revoke your proxy and change your vote prior to the Annual Meeting by:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sending a written notice of revocation to our Corporate Secretary at 100 Crystal A Drive, Hershey, Pennsylvania 17033 (the notification must be received by the close of business on May  2017);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting again by Internet or telephone prior to 11:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EDT on May 2, 2017 (only the latest vote you submit will be counted); or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Submitting a new properly signed and dated paper proxy card with a later date (your proxy card must be received before the start of the Annual Meetin
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: our shares are held in street name, you should contact your broker, bank or other holder of record about revoking your voting instructions and changing your vote prior to the Annual Meeti
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are eligible to vote at the Annual Meeting, you also can revoke your proxy or voting instructions and change your vote at the Annual Meeting by submitting a written ballot before the polls close.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: What will happen if I submit my proxy but do not vote on a proposal?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you submit a valid proxy but fail to provide instructions on how you want your shares to be voted, your proxy will be voted in the manner recommended by the Board on all matters presented in this Proxy Statement, which is as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the election of all director nominees;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the ratification of the appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as our independent auditors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the approval of the compensation of the Companys named executive officers (NEOs); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 1 YEAR as the frequency of future advisory votes on NEO compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any other item is properly presented for a vote at the Annual Meeting, the shares represented by your properly submitted proxy will be voted at the discretion of the proxies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: What will happen if I neither submit my proxy nor vote my shares in person at the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: If you are a registered stockholder, your shares will not be voted
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held in street name, your broker, bank or other holder of record may vote your shares on certain routine matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ratification of independent auditors is currently considered to be a routine matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On this matter, your broker, bank or other holder of record can:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote your street-name shares even though you have not provided voting instructions; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Choose not to vote your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The other matters you are being asked to vote on are not routine and cannot be voted by your broker, bank or other holder of record without your instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When a broker, bank or other holder of record is unable to vote shares for this reason, it is called a broker non-vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: How do I vote if I am a participant in one of the Companys 401(k) Plans?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a participant in either The Hershey Company 401(k) Plan or The Hershey Company Puerto Rico 401(k) Plan, you may have certain voting rights with respect to shares of our Common Stock credit to your account in the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You do not own these shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They are owned by the plan trustee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the plans provides you with voting rights based on the number of shares of Common Stock that were constructively invested in your plan account as of the close of business on the Record Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We originally contributed these shares to the plan on your behalf as matching or supplemental retirement contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote these shares in much the same way as registered stockholders vote their shares, but you have an earlier deadline.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote must be received by the plan trustee by 11:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EDT on April 28, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote these shares by following the instructions provided on the Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials and on the voter website, www.proxyvote.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you requested a paper copy of the proxy materials, you also may vote by mail by signing, dating and returning the proxy/voting instruction card included with those materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan trustee will submit one proxy to vote all shares of Common Stock in the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The trustee will vote the shares of Common Stock credited to participants submitting voting instructions in accordance with their instructions and will vote the shares of Common Stock in the plan for which no voting instructions were received in the same proportion as the final votes of all participants who actually voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please note that if you do not submit voting instructions for the shares of Common Stock in your account by the voting deadline, those shares will be included with the other undirected shares and voted by the trustee as described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the trustee submits one proxy to vote all shares of Common Stock in the plan, you may not vote plan shares in person at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: How do I vote my shares in the Companys Automatic Dividend Reinvestment Service Plan?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: : Computershare, our transfer agent, has arranged for any shares that you hold in the Automatic Dividend Reinvestment Service Plan to be included in the total registered shares of Common Stock shown on the Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials or proxy card we have provided you.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By voting these shares, you also will be voting your shares in the Automatic Dividend Reinvestment Service Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: What does it mean if I received more than one Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials or proxy card?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: You probably have multiple accounts with us and/or brokers, banks or other holders of record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You should vote all of the shares represented by these Notices/proxy cards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain brokers, banks and other holders of record have procedures in place to discontinue duplicate mailings upon a stockholders request.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You should contact your broker, bank or other holder of record for more information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, Computershare can assist you if you want to consolidate multiple registered accounts existing in your name.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To contact Computershare, visit their website at www.computershare.com/investor; or write to P.O Box 30170, College Station, Texas 77842-3170; or for overnight delivery, to Computershare, 211 Quality Circle, Suite 210, College Station, Texas 77845; or call:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (800) 851-4216 Domestic Holders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (201) 680-6578 Foreign Holders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (800) 952-9245 Domestic TDD line for hearing impaired
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (312) 588-4110 Foreign TDD line for hearing impaired

sentences.text: Q: How many shares must be present to conduct business at the Annual Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: To carry on the business of the Annual Meeting, a minimum number of shares, constituting a quorum, must be present, either in person or by proxy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On most matters, the votes of the holders of the Common Stock and Class B Common Stock are counted together.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, there are some matters that must be voted on only by the holders of one class of stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will have a quorum for all matters to be voted on at the Annual Meeting if the following number of votes is present, in person or by proxy:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For any matter requiring the vote of the Common Stock voting separately: a majority of the votes of the Common Stock outstanding on the Record Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For any matter requiring the vote of the Class B Common Stock voting separately: a majority of the votes of the Class B Common Stock outstanding on the Record
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For any matter requiring the vote of the Common Stock and Class B Common Stock voting together without regard to class: a majority of the votes of the Common Stock and Class B Common Stock outstanding on the Record Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is possible that we could have a quorum for certain items of business to be voted on at the Annual Meeting and not have a quorum for other matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If that occurs, we will proceed with a vote only on the matters for which a quorum is present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: What vote is required to approve each proposal?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: Assuming that a quorum is present:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 1: Election of Directors  the two nominees to be elected by holders of our Common Stock voting separately as a class who receive the greatest number of votes cast FOR, and the ten nominees to be elected by holders of our Common Stock and Class B Common Stock voting together who receive the greatest number of votes cast FOR, will be elected as directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 2: Ratification of the Appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as Independent Auditors  the affirmative vote of the holders of at least a majority of the shares of Common Stock and Class B Common Stock (voting together as a class) represented at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 3: Advise on Named Executive Officer Compensation  the affirmative vote of the holders of at least a majority of the shares of Common Stock and Class B Common Stock (voting together as a class) represented at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 4: Advise on the Frequency of Future Advisory Votes on Named Executive Officer Compensation  You are not being asked to vote for or against this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, this proposal asks stockholders to inform us how often we should conduct an advisory vote on the compensation of our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are given the option of selecting every 1, 2 or 3 years, or abstaining.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The frequency that receives the greatest number of votes from the holders of our Common Stock and Class B Common Stock voting together will be considered by the Board when determining how often the Company will conduct an advisory vote on NEO compensation in future years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: Are abstentions and broker non-votes counted in the vote totals?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions are counted as being present and entitled to vote in determining whether a quorum is present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares as to which broker non-votes exist will be counted as present and entitled to vote in determining whether a quorum is present for any matter requiring the vote of the Common Stock and Class B Common Stock voting together as a class, but they will not be counted as present and entitled to vote in determining whether a quorum is present for any matter requiring the vote of the Common Stock or Class B Common Stock voting separately as a class.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you mark or vote abstain on Proposal Nos. 2 or 3, the abstention will have the effect of being counted as a vote AGAINST the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you mark or vote abstain on Proposal No. 4, your vote will not be counted as a vote for any of the other three options under that proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes with respect to Proposal Nos. 1-4 are not included in vote totals and will not affect the outcome of the vote on those proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: Who will pay the cost of soliciting votes for the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: We will pay the cost of preparing, assembling and furnishing proxy solicitation and other required Annual Meeting materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not use a third-party solicitor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is possible that our directors, officers and employees might solicit proxies by mail, telephone, telefax, electronically over the Internet or by personal contact, without receiving additional compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will reimburse brokers, banks and other nominees, fiduciaries and custodians who nominally hold shares of our stock as of the Record Date for the reasonable costs they incur furnishing proxy solicitation and other required Annual Meeting materials to street-name holders who beneficially own those shares on the Record Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a long-standing commitment to good corporate governance practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our corporate governance policies and other documents establish the high standards of professional and personal conduct we expect of our Board, members of senior management and all employees, and promote compliance with various financial, ethical, legal and other obligations and responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: he business activities of the Company are carried out by our employees under the direction and supervision of our President and Chief Executive Officer (CEO).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is responsible for overseeing these ctivities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In doing so, each director is required to use his or her business judgment in the best interests of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards responsibilities include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewing the Companys performance, strategies and major decisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overseeing the Companys compliance with legal and regulatory requirements and the integrity of its financial statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overseeing the Companys policies and practices for identifying, managing and mitigating key enterprise risks;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overseeing management, including reviewing the CEOs performance and succession planning for key management roles; an
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overseeing executive and director compensation, and our compensation program and policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has adopted Corporate Governance Guidelines that, along with the charters of the Board committees, provide the basic framework for the Boards operation and role in the governance of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The guidelines include the Boards policies regarding director independence, qualifications and responsibilities, access to management and outside advisors, compensation, continuing education, oversight of management succession and stockholding requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They also provide a process for directors to annually evaluate the performance of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee is responsible for overseeing and reviewing the Boards Corporate Governance Guidelines at least annually and recommending any proposed changes to the Board for approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Guidelines are available on the Investors section of our website at www.thehersheycompany.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Code of Ethical Business Conduct
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has adopted a Code of Ethical Business Conduct (the Code of Conduct) that applies to all of our directors, officers and employees worldwide.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adherence to this Code of Conduct assures that our directors, officers and employees are held to the highest standards of integrity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code of Conduct covers areas such as conflicts of interest, insider trading and compliance with laws and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee oversees the Companys communication of, and compliance with, the Code of Conduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code of Conduct, including amendments thereto or waivers granted to a director or officer, if any, can be viewed on the Investors section of our website at www.thehersheycompany.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder and Interested Party Communications with Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders and other interested parties may communicate with our directors in several ways.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communications regarding accounting, internal accounting controls or auditing matters may be emailed to the Audit Committee at auditcommittee@hersheys.com or addressed to the Audit Committee at the following address:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee c/o Corporate Secretary The Hershey Company 100 Crystal A Drive P.O. Box 810 Hershey, PA 17033-0810
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders and other interested parties also can submit comments, confidentially and anonymously if desired, to the Audit Committee by calling the Hershey Concern Line at (800) 362-8321 or by accessing the Hershey Concern Line website at www.HersheysConcern.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders and other interested parties may contact any of the independent directors, including the Lead Independent Director, as well as the independent directors as a group, by writing to the specified party at the address set forth above or by emailing the independent directors (or a specific independent director, including the Lead Independent Director) at independentdirectors@hersheys.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders and other interested parties may also contact any of the independent directors using the Hershey Concern Line telephone number or website noted above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communications to the Audit Committee, any of the independent directors and the Hershey Concern Line are processed by the Office of General Counsel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Office of General Counsel reviews and summarizes these communications and provides reports to the applicable party on a periodic basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communications regarding any accounting, internal control or auditing matter are reported immediately to the Audit Committee, as are allegations about our officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee will address communications from any interested party in accordance with our Board-approved Procedures for Submission and Handling of Complaints Regarding Compliance Matters, which are available for viewing on the Investors section of our website at www.thehersheycompany.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Solicitations, junk mail and obviously frivolous or inappropriate communications are not forwarded to the Audit Committee or the independent directors, but copies are retained and made available to any director who wishes to review them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board, in consultation with the Governance Committee, determines which of our directors are independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has adopted categorical standards for independence that the Board uses in determining which directors are independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board bases its determination of independence for each director on the more stringent independence standards applicable to Audit Committee members regardless of whether such directo serves on the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These standards are contained in the Boards Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Applying these categorical standards for independence, as well as the independence requirements set forth in the listing standards of the New York Stock Exchange (the NYSE Rules) and the rules and regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), the Board determined that the following directors recommended for election at the Annual Meeting are independent: Pamela M. Arway, James W. Brown, Charles A. Davis, Mary Kay Haben, M. Diane Koken, Robert M. Malcolm, James M. Mead, Anthony J. Palmer, Thomas J. Ridge and David L. Shedlarz.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board determined that John P. Bilbrey is not independent because he served as an executive officer of the Company until March 1, 2017, and that Michele G. Buck is not independent because she is an executive officer of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n making its independence determinations, the Board, in consultation with the Governance Committee, reviewed the direct and indirect relationships between each director and the Company and its subsidiaries, as w as the compensation and other payments each director received from or made to the Company and its subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making its independence determinations with respect to Ms. Koken and Messrs. Brown and Mead, the Board considered their roles as current members of the board of directors of Hershey Trust Company and the board of managers (governing body) of Milton Hershey School, as well as certain transactions the Company had or may have with these entities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hershey Trust Company, as trustee for the trust established by Milton S. and Catherine S. Hershey that has as its sole beneficiary Milton Hershey School (such trust, the Milton Hershey School Trust), is our ontrolling stockholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hershey Trust Company is in turn owned by the Milton Hershey School Trust.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, Hershey Trust Company, Milton Hershey School, the Milton Hershey School Trust and companies wned by the Milton Hershey School Trust are considered affiliates of the Company under SEC rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, we had a number of transactions with Hershey Trust Company, Milton Hershey School and ompanies owned by the Milton Hershey School Trust involving the purchase and sale of goods and services in the ordinary course of business and the leasing of real estate at market rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have outlined these ransactions in greater detail in the section entitled Certain Transactions and Relationships.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have provided information about Company stock owned by Hershey Trust Company, as trustee for the Milton Hershey School Trust, and by Hershey Trust Company for its own investment purposes in the section entitled Information Regarding Our Controlling Stockholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Koken and Messrs. Brown and Mead do not receive any compensation from The Hershey Company, from Hershey Trust Company or from Milton Hershey School other than compensation they receive or will receive in the ordinary course as members of the board of directors or board of managers of each of those entities, as applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Ms. Koken and Messrs. Brown and Mead do not participate in Board decisions in connection with the Companys transactions with Hershey Trust Company, Milton Hershey School and companies owned by the Milton Hershey School Trust.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board therefore concluded that the positions Ms. Koken and Messrs. Brown and Mead have as members of the board of directors of Hershey Trust Company and the board of managers of Milton Hershey School do not impact their independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Nominations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee is responsible for identifying and recommending to the Board candidates for Board membership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As our controlling stockholder, Hershey Trust Company, as trustee for the Milton Hersh School Trust, also may from time to time recommend to the Governance Committee, or elect outright, individuals to serve on our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In administering its responsibilities, the Governance Committee has not adopted formal selection procedures, but instead utilizes general guidelines that allow it to adjust the selection process to best satisfy the objectives established for any director search.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee considers director candidates recommended by any reasonable source, including current directors, management, stockholders (including Hershey Trust Company, as trustee for the Milton Hershey School Trust) and other sources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee evaluates all director candidates in the same manner, regardless of the source of the recommendation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee has established a policy that it will not recommend a candidate to the full Board until all members of the Governance Committee have interviewed and approved the candidate for nomination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Occasionally, the Governance Committee engages a paid third-party consultant to assist in identifying and evaluating director candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee has sole authority under its charter to retain, compensate and terminate these consultants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Governance Committee retained Egon Zehnder to assist in identifying potential future director candidates as several current directors approach their 72nd birthday.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders desiring to recommend or nominate a director candidate must comply with certain procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a stockholder and desire to nominate a director candidate at the 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders of the Company, you must comply with the procedures for nomination set forth in the section entitled Information Regarding the 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders who do not intend o nominate a director at an annual meeting may recommend a director candidate to the Governance Committee for consideration at any time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders desiring to do so must submit their recommendation in writing to The Hershey Company, c/o Corporate Secretary, 100 Crystal A Drive, Hershey, Pennsylvania 17033-0810, and include in the submission all of the information that would be required if the stockholder nominated the candidate at an annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee may require the nominating stockholder to submit additional information before considering the candidate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There were no changes to the procedures relating to stockholder nominations during 2016, and there have been no changes to such procedures to date in 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These procedural requirements are intended to ensure the Governance Committee has sufficient time and a basis on which to assess potential director candidates and are not intended to discourage or interfere with appropriate stockholder nominations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee does not believe that these procedural requirements subject any stockholder or proposed nominee to unreasonable burdens.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee and the Board reserve the right to change the procedural requirements from time to time and/or to waive some or all of the requirements with respect to certain nominees, but any such waiver shall not preclude the Governance Committee from insisting upon ompliance with any and all of the above requirements by any other recommending stockholder or proposed nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has general oversight responsibility for the Companys affairs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Board does not have responsibility for day-to-day management of the Company, Board members stay informed about the Companys business through regular meetings, site visits and other periodic interactions with management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is deeply involved in the Companys strategic planning process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also plays an important oversight role in the Companys leadership development and succession planning processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Composition
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is currently comprised of 12 members, each serving a one-year term that expires at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ten of the 12 director nominees are considered independent under the NYSE Rules and the Boards Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys governance documents provide the Board with flexibility to select the leadership structure that is most appropriate for the Company and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board regularly evaluates its governance structure and has concluded that the Company and its stockholders are best served by not having a formal policy regarding whether the same individual should serve as both Chairman of the Board and CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This approach allows the Board to exercise its business judgment in determining the most appropriate leadership structure in light of the current facts and circumstances facing the Company, including the composition and tenure of the Board, the tenure of the CEO, the strength of the Companys management team, the Companys recent financial performance, the Companys current strategic plan and the current economic environment, among other factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Throughout 2016, John P. Bilbrey served as our Chairman of the Board and CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believed that combining the roles of Chairman of the Board and CEO under Mr. Bilbreys leadership was in the best interests of the Company and its stockholders for several reasons:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Bilbreys strong working relationship and high level of trust with the Board, gained through more than six years of service as a director;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Bilbreys deep understanding of Board governance and operations, the result of having worked with the prior Chairman of the Board and current Lead Independent Director to develop meetin topics, set meeting schedules and agendas, and ensure efficient communications among the directors; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Bilbreys unparalleled knowledge of the Company and its products, which the Board believed put him in the best position to lead the Board through the strategic business issues facing the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: fective March 1, 2017, the Board split the roles of Chairman of the Board and CEO, with Michele G. Buck assuming responsibility as President and CEO and Mr. Bilbrey transitioning to the role of Non-Executive hairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes this leadership structure is the most appropriate at this time as it enables the Company to continue to leverage Mr. Bilbreys knowledge of the Company and his expertise in oard governance and operations while allowing Ms. Buck to focus on her new responsibilities as CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: he Board also recognizes the importance of strong independent Board leadership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although no longer serving as an executive officer of the Company, the Board has determined that Mr. Bilbrey is not independent at his time due to his prior service as CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For that reason, James E. Nevels continues to serve as Lead Independent Director, a position he has held since April 2, 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Having previously served as Chairman of the oard from February 2009 until his appointment as Lead Independent Director, Mr. Nevelss service helps ensure continuity of independent Board leadership as well as effective communication between the CEO, the hairman of the Board, and the independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of the Boards Corporate Governance Guidelines, the Lead Independent Directors responsibilities include the following
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the absence of the Chairman of the Board, presiding at all Board and stockholder meetings;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Calling meetings of the independent directors of the Board, in addition to the executive sessions of independent directors held during each Board meetin
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Establishing the agenda and presiding at all executive sessions and other meetings of the independent directors of the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communicating with the independent directors of the Board between meetings as necessary or appropriate;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Serving as a liaison between the Chairman of the Board and the independent directors, ensuring independent director consensus is communicated to the Chairman of the Board, and communicating th results of meetings of the independent directors to the Chairman of the Board and members of management, as appropriate;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approving Board meeting agendas and schedules to assure there is sufficient time for discussion of all agenda items;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approving Board meeting materials and other information sent to the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Evaluating the quality and timeliness of information sent to the Board by the CEO and other members of management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assisting the Chairman of the Board on matters of Board succession planning and crisis management;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overseeing the evaluation of the CEO
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assisting the chair of the Governance Committee with Board and individual director evaluations; a
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Being available for consultation and direct communication at the request of major stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ard has determined that Mr. Nevels is an independent member of the Board under the NYSE Rules and the Boards Corporate Governance Guideli
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Nevels is not standing for re-election as a director at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the terms of the Boards Corporate Governance Guidelines, the independent directors are currently considering potential candidates from among the other independent members of the Board to replace Mr. Nevels as Lead Independent Director upon expiration of his term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n addition to the Lead Independent Director role, the Board has established five standing committees to assist with its oversight responsibilities: (1) Audit Committee; (2) Compensation and Executive Organization Committee (Compensation Committee); (3) Finance and Risk Management Committee; (4) Governance Committee; and (5) Executive Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the Audit Committee, the Compensation Committee, the inance and Risk Management Committee, and the Governance Committee is comprised entirely of independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, Mr. Mead is a direct representative of the Companys largest stockholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This omposition of our Board helps to ensure that boardroom discussions reflect the views of management, our independent directors and our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Role in Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board takes an active role in risk oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While management is responsible for identifying, evaluating, managing and mitigating the Companys exposure to risk, it is the Boards responsibility to oversee the Companys risk management process and to ensure that management is taking appropriate action to identify, manage and mitigate key risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board administers its risk oversight responsibilities both through active review and discussion of key risks facing the Company and by delegating certain risk oversight responsibilities to committees for further consideration and evaluation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In August 2009, the Board established the Finance and Risk Management Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This committee was established, in part, to enhance the Boards oversight of how senior management manages the material risks facing the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table summarizes the role of the Board and each of its committees in overseeing risk:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Governing Body    Role in Risk Oversight   Board       Regularly reviews and evaluates the Companys strategic plans and associated risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Oversees the Companys enterprise risk management (ERM) framework and the overall ERM process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Conducts annual succession plan reviews to ensure the Company maintains appropriate succession plans for members of senior management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee       Oversees compliance with legal and regulatory requirements and the Companys Code of Conduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Oversees risks relating to key accounting policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviews internal controls with the Principal Financial Officer, Principal Accounting Officer and internal auditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meets regularly with representatives of the Companys independent auditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation and Executive Organization Committee       Oversees risks relating to the Companys compensation program and policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Oversees the process for conducting annual risk assessments of the Companys compensation policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employs independent compensation consultants to assist in reviewing the Companys compensation program, including the potential risks created by such program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Oversees the Companys succession planning and talent processes and programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finance and Risk Management Committee       Reviews enterprise-level and other key risks identified through the Companys ERM process as well as managements plans to mitigate those risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Oversees key financial risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Oversees and approves proposed merger and acquisition activities and related risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chair meets at least annually with the Audit Committee to discuss the Companys risk management programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Governance Committee       Oversees risks relating to the Companys governance structure and other corporate governance matters and processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Oversees compliance with key corporate governance documents, including the Corporate Governance Guidelines and the Insider Trading Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Committee       Reviews and approves, through a special committee of independent directors on the Executive Committee, any related party transactions between the Company and entities affiliated with the Company and certain of its directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The decision to administer the Boards oversight responsibilities in this manner has an important effect on the Boards leadership and committee structure, described in more detail above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that its structure  including a strong Lead Independent Director, 10 of 12 independent directors and key committees comprised entirely of independent directors  helps to ensure that key strategic decisions made by senior management, up to and including the CEO, are reviewed and overseen by independent directors of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Experiences, Skills and Qualifications
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee works with the Board to determine the appropriate characteristics, skills and experiences that should be possessed by the Board as a whole as well as its individual members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Governance Committee has not established minimum criteria for director candidates, in general, the Board seeks individuals with skills and backgrounds that will complement those of other directors and maximize the diversity and effectiveness of the Board as a whole.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also seeks individuals who bring unique and varied perspectives and life experiences to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, the Governance Committee assists the Board by recommending prospective director candidates who will enhance the overall diversity of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board views diversity broadly, taking into consideration the age, professional experience, race, education, gender and other attributes of its members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Boards Corporate Governance Guidelines describe the general experiences, qualifications, attributes and skills sought by the Board of any director nominee, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Qualifications, Attributes and Skills   Knowledge and Experience  Integrity     Finance  Judgment     International business  Skill     Marketing  Diversity     Mergers and acquisitions  Ability to express informed, useful and constructive views     Supply chain management  Experience with business and other organizations of comparable size     Information technology  Ability to commit the time necessary to learn our business and to prepare for and participate actively in committee meetings and in Board meetings     Human resources  Experience and how it relates to the experiences of the other Board members     Consumer products  Overall desirability as an addition to the Board and its committees     Government, public policy and regulatory affairs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to evaluating new director candidates, the Governance Committee regularly assesses the composition of the Board in order to ensure it reflects an appropriate balance of knowledge, skills, expertise, diversity and independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of this assessment, each director is asked to identify and assess the particular experiences, skills and other attributes that qualify him or her to serve as a member of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the most recent assessment of the Boards composition completed in February 2017, the Governance Committee and the Board have determined that, in light of the Companys current business structure and strategies, the Board has an appropriate mix of director experiences, skills, qualifications and backgrounds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A description of the most relevant experiences, skills, attributes and qualifications that qualify each director nominee to serve as a member of the Board is included in his or her biography.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director attended at least 83% of all of the meetings of the Board and committees of the Board on which he or she served in 2016.

sentences.text: Average attendance for all of these meetings equaled 94%.

sentences.text: In addition, the independent directors meet regularly in executive session at every Board meeting and at other times as the independent directors deem necessary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These meetings allow the independent directors to discuss important issues, including the business and affairs of the Company as well as matters concerning management, without any member of management present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each executive session is chaired by the Lead Independent Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the absence of the Lead Independent Director, executive sessions are chaired by an independent director assigned on a rotating basis.

sentences.text: Members of the Audit Committee, Compensation Committee, Finance and Risk Management Committee, and Governance Committee also meet regularly in executive session.

sentences.text: Election Procedures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have two classes of common stock outstanding: Common Stock and Class B Common Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our certificate of incorporation and by-la
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One-sixth of the total number of our directors (which equates presently to two directors) will be elected by the holders of our Common Stock voting separately as a class.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2017 Annual Meeting, the Board has nominated Mary Kay Haben and Robert M. Malcolm for election by the holders of our Common Stock voting separately as a class.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The remaining 10 directors will be elected by the holders of our Common Stock and Class B Common Stock voting together without regard to cla
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to the nominees to be elected by the holders of the Common Stock and the Class B Common Stock voting together, the nine nominees receiving the greatest number of votes of the Common Stock and Class B Common Stock will be elected as directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to the nominees to be elected by the holders of the Common Stock voting separately as a class, the two nominees receiving the greatest number of votes of the Common Stock will be elected as directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards Corporate Governance Guidelines provide that directors will generally not be nominated for re-election after their 72nd birthday.

sentences.text: NON-EMPLOYEE DIRECTOR COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Hershey Company Directors Compensation Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain a Directors Compensation Plan that is designed to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attract and retain highly qualified, non-employee directors; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Align the interests of non-employee directors with those of our stockholders by paying a portion of non-employee compensation in units representing shares of our Common Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors who are employees of the Company receive no additional compensation for their service on our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Bilbrey, our current Chairman of the Board, is the only employee of the Company who also served s a director during 2016 and thus received no additional compensation for his Board service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board targets non-employee director compensation at the 50th percentile of compensation paid to directors at a peer group of companies we call the 2016 Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information about the 2016 Peer Group is included in the section entitled Setting Compensation in the Compensation Discussion & Analysis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, with the assistance of the Compensation Committee and the Compensation Committees compensation consultant, the Board reviews the compensation paid to directors at companies in the current peer group to determine whether any changes to non-employee director compensation are warranted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of its review in December 2015, the Board determined that no changes to non-employee director compensation were warranted for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, compensation paid to non-employee directors in 2016 was as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Form of Compensation     Payment ($)   Annual retainer for other non-employee directors     100,000  Annual restricted stock unit (RSU) award     135,000  Annual fee for Lead Independent Director(1)     25,000  Annual fee for chairs of Audit, Compensation, and Finance and Risk Management Committees(1)     15,000  Annual fee for chair of Governance Committee(1)     10,000
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Paid in addition to $100,000 annual retainer for non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board completed its annual review of non-employee director compensation in December 2016 and determined that the following changes were warranted for 2017 to ensure that the program remains aligned to the 50th percentile of compensation paid to directors from our 2016 Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board elected to increase the annual RSU award from $135,000 to $150,000 and to increase the annual Governance Committee Chair retainer from $10,000 to $15,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also elected to increase the non-employee director stock ownership guidelines, as described below, from four times the annual retainer to five times the annual retainer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except for these changes, all other elements of the non-employee director compensation program described above remain unchanged for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payment of Annual Retainer, Lead Independent Director Fee and Committee Chair Fees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual retainer and any applicable Lead Independent Director or committee chair fees for all non-employee directors are paid in quarterly installments on the 15th day of March, June, September and December, or the prior business day if the 15th is not a business day.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors may elect to receive all or a portion of the annual retainer in cash or in Common Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors may also elect to defer receipt of all or a portion of the retainer, Lead Independent Director fee or committee chair fees until the date their membership on the Board ends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lead Independent Director and committee chair fees that are not deferred are paid only in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors choosing to defer all or a portion of their retainer, Lead Independent Director fee or committee chair fees may invest the deferred amounts in two ways:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In a cash account that values the performance of the investment based upon the performance of one or more third-party investment funds selected by the director from among the mutual funds or oth investment options available to all employees participating in our 401(k) Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts invested in the cash account are paid only in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In a deferred common stock unit account that we value according to the performance of our Common Stock, including reinvested dividends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts invested in the deferred common stock unit account are paid in shares of Common Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock Units
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RSUs are granted quarterly to non-employee directors on the first day of January, April, July and October.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the number of RSUs granted in each quarter was determined by dividing $33,750 by the average closing price of a share of our Common Stock on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) on the last three trading days preceding the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RSUs awarded to non-employee directors vest one year after the date of grant, or earlier upon termination of the directors membership on the Board by reason of retirement (termination of service from the Board after the directors 60th birthday), death or disability, for any reason after  Change in Control as defined in our Executive Benefits Protection Plan (Group 3A) (EBPP 3A), or under such other circumstances as the Board may determine.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vested RSUs are payable to directors in shares of Common Stock or, at the option of the director, can be deferred as common stock units under the Directors Compensation Plan until the directors membership on the Board ends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividend equivalent units are credite at regular rates on the RSUs during the restriction period and, upon vesting of the RSUs, are payable in shares of Common Stock or deferred as common stock units together with any RSUs the director has deferred.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of March 6, 2017, Messrs. Davis, Malcolm, Mead, Nevels, Ridge and Shedlarz and Mmes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Arway and Haben had attained retirement age for purposes of the vesting of RSUs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Compensation, Reimbursements and Programs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board occasionally establishes committees of limited duration for special purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When a special committee is established, the Board will determine whether to provide non-employee directors with additional compensation for service on such committee based on the expected duties of the committee, the anticipated number and length of any committee meetings, and other factors the Board, in its discretion, may deem relevant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Board approved payments of $25,000 to Ms. Arway as Chair and $20,000 to each of Ms. Haben and Messrs. Malcolm, Mead, Nevels and Shedlarz for their service on the special committee established in connection with the Companys Chief Executive Officer search.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We reimburse our directors for travel and other out-of-pocket expenses they incur when attending Board and committee meetings and for minor incidental expenses they incur when performing directors services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also provide reimbursement for at least one director continuing education program each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors receive travel accident insurance while traveling on the Companys business and receive discounts on the purchase of our products to the same extent and on the same terms as our employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors also are eligible to participate in the Companys Gift Matching Program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Gift Matching Program, the Company will match, upon a directors request, contributions made by the director to one or more charitable organizations, on a dollar-for-dollar basis up to a maximum aggregate contribution of $5,000 annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the Boards Corporate Governance Guidelines, non-employee directors are expected to own shares of Common Stock having a value equal to at least five times the annual retainer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each non-employee director has until January 1 of the year following his or her fifth anniversary of becoming a director to satisfy the guideline.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews the stock ownership guidelines annually to ensure they are aligned with external market comparisons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to December 2016, non-employee directors were expected to own shares of Common Stock having a value equal to at least four times the annual retainer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of the annual review completed in December 2016, the Board, upon the recommendation of the Compensation Committee, elected to increase the non-employee director stock ownership guidelines from four times the annual retainer to five times the annual retainer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Boards Corporate Governance Guidelines, each non-employee director serving on the Board as of the date of the increase has until January 1, 2019 to satisfy the new stock ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any non-employee director serving on the Board that had not yet reached his or her initial compliance date as of the date of the increase has until the second anniversary of such initial compliance date to satisfy the new stock ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information Regarding Our Controlling Stockholder
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 1909, Milton S. and Catherine S. Hershey established a trust having as its sole beneficiary Milton Hershey School, a non-profit school for the full-time care and education of disadvantaged children located in Hershey, Pennsylvania.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hershey Trust Company, a state-chartered trust company, is trustee of the Milton Hershey School Trust.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In its capacity as trustee for the Milton Hershey School Trust, Hershey Trust Company is our controlling stockholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this capacity, it will have the right to cast 8.4% of all of the votes entitled to be cast on matters requiring the vote of the Common Stock voting separately and 81.6% of all of the votes entitled to be cast on matters requiring the vote of the Common Stock and Class B Common Stock voting together.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board of directors of Hershey Trust Company, with the approval of the board of managers (governing body) of Milton Hershey School, decides how funds held by Hershey Trust Company, as trustee for the Milton Hershey School Trust, will be invested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board of directors of Hershey Trust Company generally decides how shares of The Hershey Company held by Hershey Trust Company, as trustee for the Milton Hershey School Trust, will be voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the Record Date, Hershey Trust Company also held 149,500 shares of our Common Stock as investments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board of directors or management of Hershey Trust Company decides how these shares will be voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In all, Hershey Trust Company, as trustee for the Milton Hershey School Trust and as direct owner of investment shares, will be entitled to vote 12,903,021 shares of our Common Stock and 60,612,012 shares of our Class B Common Stock at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stated in terms of voting power, Hershey Trust Company will have the right to cast 8.5% of all of the votes entitled to be cast on matters requiring the vote of the Common Stock voting separately and 81.6% of all of the votes entitled to be cast on matters requiring the vote of the Common Stock and Class B Common Stock voting together at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our certificate of incorporation contains the following important provisions regarding our Class B Common Stock:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All holders of Class B Common Stock, including Hershey Trust Company, as trustee for Milton Hershey School, may convert any of their Class B Common Stock shares into shares of our Common Stock at any time on a share-for-share basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shares of Class B Common Stock will automatically be converted to shares of Common Stock on a share-for-share basis if Hershey Trust Company, as trustee for Milton Hershey School, or any successor trustee, or Milton Hershey School, as appropriate, ceases to hold more than 50% of the total Class B Common Stock shares outstanding and at least 15% of the total Common Stock and Class B Common Stock shares outstanding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We must obtain the approval of Hershey Trust Company, as trustee for Milton Hershey School, or any successor trustee, or Milton Hershey School, as appropriate, before we issue any Common Stock or take any other action that would deprive Hershey Trust Company, as trustee for Milton Hershey School, or any successor trustee, or Milton Hershey School, as appropriate, of the ability to cast a majority of the votes on any matter where the Class B Common Stock is entitled to vote, either separately as a class or together with any other class.
