sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To Our Stockholders:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is currently comprised of four directors, each of whom is considered independent under the NYSE Rules and the rules and regulations of the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that each member of the Audit Committee is financially literate and that each of Messrs. Davis, Mead and Nevels qualifies as an audit committee financial expert, as that term is defined under the rules promulgated by the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our role as the Audit Committee is to assist the Board in its oversight of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The integrity of the Companys financial statements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys compliance with legal and regulatory requirement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent auditors qualifications and independence; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance of the independent auditors and the Companys internal audit function.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee operates under a written charter that was last reviewed by the Audit Committee on December 5, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ur duties as an Audit Committee include overseeing the Companys management, internal auditors and independent auditors in their performance of the following functions, for which they are responsible:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Preparing the Companys financial statements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Establishing effective financial reporting systems and internal controls and procedures; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reporting on the effectiveness of the Companys internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Internal Audit Department
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independently assessing managements system of internal controls and procedures; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reporting on the effectiveness of that system.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent Auditors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Auditing the Companys financial statements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Expressing an opinion about the financial statements conformity with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annually auditing the effectiveness of the Companys internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: meet periodically with management, the internal auditors and independent auditors, independently and collectively, to discuss the quality of the Companys financial reporting process and the adequacy and tiveness of the Companys internal controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to the Company filing its Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016 with the SEC, we also:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewed and discussed the audited financial statements with management and the independent auditors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discussed with the independent auditors the matters required to be discussed by applicable requirements of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Received the written disclosures and the letter from the independent auditors in accordance with applicable requirements of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board regarding the independent auditors communications with the Audit Committee concerning independence; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discussed with the independent auditors their independence from the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are not employees of the Company and are not performing the functions of auditors or accountants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are not responsible as an Audit Committee or individually to conduct field work or other types of auditing r accounting reviews or procedures or to set auditor independence standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In carrying out our duties as Audit Committee members, we have relied on the information provided to us by management and the ndependent auditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consequently, we do not assure that the audit of the Companys financial statements has been carried out in accordance with generally accepted auditing standards, that the financial statements are resented in accordance with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles or that the Companys auditors are in fact independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the reports and discussions described in this report, and subject to the limitations on our role and responsibilities as an Audit Committee referred to above and in our charter, we recommended to the Board that he audited financial statements be included in the Companys Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016, filed with the SEC on February 21, 2017.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This section discusses and analyzes the decisions we made concerning the compensation of our named executive officers (NEOs) for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It also describes the process for determining executive compensation and the factors considered in determining the amount of compensation awarded to our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs for 2016 are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Name    Title John P. Bilbrey(1)    Chairman of the Board, President and Chief Executive Officer (CEO) Patricia A. Little    Senior Vice President, Chief Financial Officer (CFO) Michele G. Buck(2)    Executive Vice President, Chief Operating Officer (COO) Terence L. ODay    Senior Vice President, Chief Supply Chain Officer Leslie M. Turner    Senior Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) On March 1, 2017, Mr. Bilbrey retired from the position of President and CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He continues to serve as Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On June 2, 2016, Ms. Buck was promoted from President, North America to Executive Vice President, COO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On March 1, 2017, Ms. Buck became our President and CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Hershey Company (the Company), headquartered in Hershey, Pa., is a global confectionery leader known for bringing goodness to the world through its chocolate, sweets, mints and other great-tasting snacks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have approximately 17,980 employees around the world who work every day to deliver delicious, quality products.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have more than 80 brands that drive approximately $7.4 billion in annual revenues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Building on its core business, the Company is expanding its portfolio to include a broader range of delicious snacks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company remains focused on growing its presence in key international markets while continuing to extend its competitive advantage in North America.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: January 2016, we announced the following Company expectations, which are substantially reflected in our 2016 incentive programs:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Increase constant currency net sales(1) around 3% from 2015; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Increase adjusted earnings per share-diluted(2) about 6% from 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1)  While we report our financial results in accordance with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP), we also use non-GAAP financial measures within Managements Discussion and Analysis in the 2016 Annual Report on Form 10-K that accompanies this Proxy Statement in order to provide additional information to investors to facilitate the comparison of past and present performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some of the financial targets under our short- and long-term incentive programs are also based on non-GAAP financial measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-GAAP financial measures are used by management in evaluating results of operations internally and in assessing the impact of known trends and uncertainties on our business, but they are not intended to replace the presentation of financial results in accordance with GAAP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Constant currency net sales is a non-GAAP financial measure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To calculate net sales on a constant currency basis, net sales for the current fiscal year period for entities reporting in currencies other than the U.S. dollar are translated into U.S. dollars at the average rates durin the comparable period of the prior fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2)  Adjusted earnings per share-diluted is a non-GAAP financial measure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We define adjusted earnings per share-diluted as diluted earnings per share of the Companys common stock (Common Stock), excluding unallocated mark-to-market losses on commodity derivatives, costs associated with business realignment activities, costs relating to the integration of acquisitions, non-service related components of our pension expense (income) (NSRPE(I)), goodwill and other intangible asset impairment charges, settlement of the Shanghai Golden Monkey liability in conjunction with the purchase of the remaining 20% of the outstanding shares of Shanghai Golden Monkey, the gain realized on the sale of a trademark, costs associated with the early extinguishment of debt and other non-recurring gains and losses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In April 2016, we lowered our guidance for our expected 2016 constant currency net sales increase to 2.5% and for our expected 2016 adjusted earnings per share-diluted increase to 3% to 4%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See the section entitled Annual Incentives for more information regarding our 2016 annual incentive targets and related results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual results for 2016 were as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While we did not meet our expectations for net sales growth, we exceeded our adjusted earnings per share-diluted expectations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because of our mixed financial performance results, our NEOs earned significantly below-target performance stock unit (PSU) payouts and slightly above-target annual cash incentive awards, as described further in the sections entitled Long-Term Incentives and Annual Incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hershey Has Strong Pay-for-Performance Alignment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation and Executive Organization Committee (the Compensation Committee) of our Board of Directors (the Board) has oversight responsibility for our executive compensation framework and for aligning our executives pay with the Companys performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe we have a strong pay-for-performance alignment because a significant portion of each NEOs target total direct compensation is tied to the financial performance of the Company as well as shareholder returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, approximately 70% of our CEOs and 60% of our other NEOs target total direct compensation was variable and tied to Company performance, including a substantial portion tied to shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, 34% of our PSUs were tied to Total Shareholder Return (TSR).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Combined with the other financial and strategic metrics that determine our NEOs compensation, we have aligned our executive compensation program with the long-term interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over the last three years, we have delivered a TSR of 14%, which is at the bottom of our Financial Peer Group described in the section entitled Performance Stock Unit Targets and Results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because our TSR metric was below threshold for the 2014-2016 PSU cycle, our NEOs received a 0% payout for this metric, significantly reducing their overall PSU payout, as described in more detail in the section entitled Performance Stock Unit Targets and Results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Stockholders Strongly Approve of Our Pay Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Last year, our stockholders overwhelmingly approved our say-on-pay resolution, with more than 93% of the votes cast by the holders of Common Stock and more than 99% of the combined votes cast by the holders of the Common Stock and Class B Common Stock voting in favor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee believes the results of last years say-on-pay vote affirmed our stockholders support of our Companys executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consequentially, our approach to executive compensation in 2016 was substantially the same as the approach stockholders approved in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In keeping with the preference expressed by our stockholders at the 2011 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, our Board has committed to having an annual say-on-pay vote as described in Proposal No. 3  Approval of Named Executive Officer Compensation on a Non-Binding Advisory Basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking stockholders to express a preference for the frequency of the say-on-pay vote, pursuant to Section 14A of the Exchange Act, in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our compensation and governance policies and practices are significant drivers of our stockholder support.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These policies and practices include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay for performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A substantial percentage of each of our NEOs target total direct compensation is variable, performance-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance measures support strategic objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance measures we use for our variable, performance-based compensation reflect strategic and operating objectives, creating long- term value for our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Appropriate risk-taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We set performance goals that consider our publicly-announced financial expectations, which we believe will encourage appropriate risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our incentive programs are appropriately capped so as not to encourage excessive risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No tax gross-ups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not provide tax gross-ups, except for relocation expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Double-trigger benefits in the event of a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of a change in control, the payment of severance benefits and the acceleration of vesting of time-based long-term incentive awards are double-trigger benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The severance payments and accelerated vesting of continuing incentive awards will not occur unless there is also a qualifying termination of employment upon or within two years following the change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No re-pricings or exchanges of underwater stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stockholder-approved Equity and Incentive Compensation Plan (EICP) prohibits re-pricing or exchange of underwater stock options without stockholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Do not provide excessive perquisites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive perquisites are kept to a minimal level relative to a NEOs total compensation and do not play a significant role in our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Do not provide for the prepayment of dividends on unearned PSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividends are not paid on PSU awards during the three-year performance cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Significant stock ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs and other executives are required to accumulate and hold stock equal to a multiple of base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an executive has not met his or her ownership requirement in a timely manner, the executive is required to retain a portion of shares received under long-term incentive awards until the requirements are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Anti-hedging policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs, directors and other insiders are prohibited from entering into hedging transactions related to our stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Anti-pledging policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs, directors and other insiders are prohibited from entering into pledging transactions related to our stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawbacks and other covenants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the protection of the Company, we require our NEOs to enter into an Employee Confidentiality and Restrictive Covenant Agreement (ECRCA) as a condition of receipt of long-term incentive awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Failure to comply with the ECRCA may subject the employee to cancellation of awards and a requirement to repay amounts received from awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the EICP, when an individuals actions result in the filing of financial documents not in compliance with financial reporting requirements, the Company has the right to recoup or require repayment of an award earned or accrued during the 12-month period following the first public issuance or filing with the SEC of the financial document not in compliance with suc financial reporting requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Role and Philosophy of the Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has primary responsibility for making compensation decisions for our NEOs other than our CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEOs compensation is approved by the independent members of the Board based on the recommendations of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee operates under a charter approved by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee uses information from Mercer (US) Inc. (Mercer), the Compensation Committees independent executive compensation consultant, input from our CEO (except for matters regarding his own pay) and assistance from our Human Resources Department to make decisions and to conduct its annual review of the Companys executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee works with a rolling agenda, with its heaviest workload occurring during the first quarter of the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During this quarter, decisions are made with respect to annual and long-term incentives earned based on the prior years performance and target compensation levels are finalized for the current year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also reviews and approves this Compensation Discussion & Analysis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the second and third quarters, the Compensation Committee reviews materials relating to peer group composition, tally sheets, competitive pay analysis and other information that forms the foundation for future decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee uses the third and fourth quarters to finalize decisions relating to the peer group and compensation plan design for use in the upcoming year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may, in its discretion, delegate all or a portion of its duties and responsibilities to a subcommittee of the Compensation Committee and, pursuant to the provisions of the EICP, may appoint the CEO as a committee of the Board as necessary for the purpose of making equity grants under the EICP; provided, however, the Compensation Committee may not delegate the approval of certain ransactions to a subcommittee or to the CEO if such transactions involve the approval or grant of equity-based compensation to an officer for purposes of Rule 16b-3 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 Exchange Act) or a covered employee for purposes of Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code (IRC) unless such subcommittee consists solely of members of the Compensation Committee who are
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) Non-Employee Directors for the purposes of Rule 16b-3 under the Exchange Act, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) outside directors for the purposes of Section 162(m) of the IRC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The philosophy of our executive compensation program is to provide a compelling, dynamic, market-based total compensation program tied to performance and aligned with our stockholders interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our goal is to nsure the Company has the talent it needs to maintain sustained long-term performance for our stockholders, employees and communities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The guiding principles that help us achieve this goal are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recruit and retain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our program is designed to be market competitive and flexible to recruit and retain top talent for our critical roles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay for performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A significant portion of our executives compensation is tied to the performance of our Company, rewarding executives for both short-term and long-term progress towards o strategic and operational goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Aligned with strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation program is aligned with the strategies of our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Aligned with stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation program, through both design and payouts, is aligned with the long-term interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reinforce robust succession planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation program plays a key role in making sure we have the talent we need for long-term success and to deliver our Company strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Data-driven decision making.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We design our executive compensation program and make pay decisions considering a balance of information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Advisor Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under its engagement letter with the Compensation Committee, Mercer has acknowledged that the firm is retained by and performs its services for the Compensation Committee while working with management to provide advice, counsel and recommendations that reinforce the Companys business strategy, economics, organization and management style.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mercer has provided and continues to provide services and products to the Company in addition to its work for the Compensation Committee, including services related to global compensation consulting and surveys for various geographies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mercer and its affiliates also provide products and services to the Company that are unrelated to compensation, including expatriate consulting services (provided by Mercer), international benefits consulting and claims processing services (provided by Mercer) and coordination of certain third party health and welfare benefits (coordinated by Marsh).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mercers affiliates, Marsh USA Inc. and Marsh INSCO LLC, provided property and casualty insurance consulting services until June 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews all fees for services related to executive and director compensation provided by Mercer to the Compensation Committee, as well as fees for compensation-related products and services provided to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The decision to engage Mercer for other services was made by management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Neither the Compensation Committee nor the Board has a role in the engagement of Mercer or Mercer affiliates that provide products or services to the Company that are unrelated to compensation; however, the Compensation Committee reviews the fees for such products and services concurrently with its review of compensation-related fees paid to Mercer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fees paid to Mercer and its affiliates for services provided in 2016 related to executive and director compensation totaled $476,782.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fees paid to Mercer and its affiliates for other services provided in 2016 were as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation-related products and services    $ 116,301  Services unrelated to compensation    $ 294,401     Total other services    $ 410,702
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also received and discussed with Mercer its letter to the Compensation Committee addressing factors relevant under the Securities Exchange Commission (SEC) and New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) rules in assessing Mercers independence from management and whether Mercers work for the Compensation Committee has raised any conflicts of interest, as well as Mercers belief that no conflict of interest exists and that it serves as an independent advisor to the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The factors addressed included the extent of any business or personal relationships with any member of the Compensation Committee or any executive officer of the Company; Mercers and its affiliates provision of other services to the Company; the level of fees received from the Company as a percentage of total revenue of each of Mercer and Mercers parent company; the policies and procedures employed by Mercer to avoid conflicts of interest; and any ownership of Company stock by individuals employed by Mercer to advise the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considered these factors before selecting or receiving advice from Mercer, and after considering these and other factors in their totality, the Compensation Committee identified no conflicts of interest with respect to Mercers advice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In establishing compensation levels and awards for executive officers other than our CEO, the Compensation Committee takes into consideration the recommendations of Mercer and the Human Resources Department, evaluations by our CEO of each officers individual performance and Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee evaluates director compensation primarily on the basis of peer group data used for benchmarking director compensation provided by Mercer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Setting Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees annual compensation review for 2016 included an analysis of data, comparing the Companys executive and director compensation levels against a peer group of publicly-held consumer products companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mercer provides the Compensation Committee with advice, counsel and recommendations with respect to the composition of the peer group and competitive data used for benchmarking our compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee uses this and other information provided by Mercer to reach an independent recommendation regarding compensation to be paid to our CEO, directors and other officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees final recommendation is then given to the independent directors of our Board for review and final approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Before 2015, the Company had two separate peer groups, which we referred to as our Compensation Peer Group and our Financial Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2015, the Compensation Committee has utilized one common peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Companies in the peer group used to benchmark executive and director pay levels for 2016 (the 2016 Peer Group) are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hormel Foods Corporation Kellogg Company McCormick & Company, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mead Johnson Nutrition Company Molson Coors Brewing Company Mondelez International The Clorox Company The J. M. Smucker Company
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Brown-Forman Corporation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Colgate-Palmolive Company
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Constellation Brands, Inc
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General Mills, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee selected these companies after reviewing publicly-held companies offering products/services similar to ours, with annual revenues within a range of approximately one-half to two and one-half times our annual revenue (with the exception of Mondelez International whom we also consider a peer company for executive talent) and market capitalization within a reasonable range of our market capitalization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 Peer Group was composed of companies with annual revenues ranging from $3.6 billion to $29.6 billion (as of fiscal year 2015) and market capitalization ranging from $1.6 billion to $71.3 billion (as of December 31, 2015).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hersheys fiscal year 2015 revenue of $7.4 billion and December 31, 2015 market capitalization of $19.4 billion were at the 51st and 56th percentiles, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except for Colgate-Palmolive Company and Mead Johnson Nutrition Company, all of the companies in our 2016 Peer Group were included in our 2015 Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Kraft Foods Group, included in 2015, was not included in the 2016 Peer Group due to a merger occurring in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Data from the 2016 Peer Group was supplemented by composite data from consumer products companies ranging in size from $3 billion to $17 billion in approximate annual sales.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This information was included in three national surveys conducted by Aon Hewitt, Mercer and Towers Watson.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The survey composite data provided us with broader, industry-specific information regarding pay levels at consumer products companies for our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviewed a report summarizing compensation levels at the 25th, 50th and 75th percentiles of the 2016 Peer Group and the survey composite data for positions comparable to those held by each of our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also reviewed a report comparing the target total cash compensation (base salary plus target annual incentive) and target total direct compensation (base salary plus target annual incentive plus target long-term incentive) for each of the NEOs against these benchmarks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For retention and competitive considerations, the Company targets each NEOs total cash compensation and total direct compensation levels around the 50th percentile of the 2016 Peer Group data or survey composite data applicable to his or her position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees final determinations with respect to base salary, target annual incentive compensation and target long-term incentive compensation reflect consideration of the Companys and the NEOs performance, internal comparisons and other factors the Compensation Committee deems appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of these factors, the target total cash compensation and target total direct compensation of our NEOs in 2016 was generally set around the applicable median.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, the Compensation Committee received detailed tally sheets prepared by management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each tally sheet captures comprehensive compensation, benefits and stock ownership data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The tally sheets provide he Compensation Committee with a complete picture of each executives current and projected compensation and the amount of each element of compensation or other benefit the executive would receive in the event of voluntary or involuntary termination, retirement, disability, death, or upon change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers this information, as well as the benchmark information, when making compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salary is the largest fixed component of our executive compensation program and is determined by considering the relative importance of the position, the competitive marketplace and the individuals performance, responsibilities and experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Salary reviews are generally conducted annually at the beginning of the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each NEOs base salary is compared to internal and external references.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salary adjustments, if any, are made after considering market references, Company performance against financial goals and individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO performance is evaluated by the Compensation Committee and independent members of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO evaluates the performance of his direct reports, including all NEOs, and reviews his recommendations for salary adjustments with the Compensation Committee prior to its approval of the base salary for each NEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a NEO has responsibility for a particular business unit, the business units financial results also will be strongly considered.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On the basis of the foregoing considerations, the Compensation Committee, and all independent directors in the case of our CEO, approved base salaries for 2016 as follow
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs are eligible to receive an annual cash incentive award under the One Hershey Incentive Program (OHIP), a program established under our EICP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The OHIP links the NEOs payout opportunity to measures he or she can affect most directly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, our CEO and all employees reporting directly to him, including the NEOs, had common financial objectives tied to total Company performance consistent with their responsibility to manage the entire Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total Company performance targets are established in the context of our announced expectations for financial performance, prior year results and market conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, our NEOs were eligible to earn individual OHIP awards as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Name   2016 Target One Hershey Incentive Program (% of Base Salary)     Percent of Target Total Direct Compensation (%)     Mr. Bilbrey     150      20.7  Ms. Little     80      21.3  Ms. Buck     90(1)      21.0(1)  Mr. ODay     65      19.4  Ms. Turner     70      20.6
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Ms. Bucks target was initially set at 85% in January 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon her promotion to Executive Vice President, COO, Ms. Bucks target increased to 90%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The percent of target total direct compensation for Ms. Buck is based on a base salary of $716,274, reflecting her target base salary both before and after the June increase.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining the target OHIP percentage for each of the NEOs, the Compensation Committee, and the independent directors in the case of our CEO, considered the value of target total cash compensation against market references.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target total cash compensation levels for each of the NEOs fall within an appropriate range relative to the median for comparable positions given each incumbents performance, responsibilities and tenure in the role.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, the final OHIP award is determined by multiplying the NEOs base salary, the applicable target percentage and performance scores ranging from 0% to 200% based on Company and individual performance The Company performance goals are established at the beginning of each year by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individual performance goals also are established at that time, or at the time of hire if later.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If performance scores exceed the target objectives, a NEO may receive an OHIP payout greater than his or her target award value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If performance scores are below the target objectives, the NEOs OHIP payout will be below his or her target award value, subject to no award if performance is below threshold levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, Company financial performance metrics accounted for 65% of each NEOs target award under the program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The remaining 35% was based upon individual performance toward achievement of up to six individual performance goals focused on strategic priorities applicable to the NEOs position, but tied to the overall Companys top priorities for the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide long-term incentive opportunities to motivate, retain and reward our NEOs for their contributions to multi-year performance in achieving strategies and improving long-term share value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February of each year, the Compensation Committee awards long-term incentive grants to our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to 2016, long-term incentive grants were comprised of PSUs and stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we updated our equity mix to include RSUs, increasing the retentive value of our long-term incentive program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee, and the independent directors in the case of our CEO, determines the value of long-term incentive awards made to each NEO by considering the NEOs target total direct compensation against internal and external references.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSUs are granted to NEOs and other executives in a position to affect the Companys long-term results.

sentences.text: At the start of each three-year cycle, a contingent target number of PSUs is established for each executive.

sentences.text: Stock Options
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options are an important element of our long-term incentive program, enabling us to align the interests of NEOs with those of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, stock options are awarded annually to the Companys executives as well as to other key managerial employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options entitle the holder to purchase a fixed number of shares of Common Stock at a set price during a specified period of time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The right to exercise the options is subject to a vesting schedule.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because stock options vest over time and only have value if the price of our Common Stock increases, they encourage efforts to enhance long-term stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee sets guidelines for the value of stock options to be awarded based on competitive compensation data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The stock option award represents approximately one-quarter of the NEOs long- term incentive compensation target award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the target number of stock options awarded to each NEO was determined by multiplying the NEOs base salary by one-quarter of his or her target long-term incentive award percentage divided by the Black-Scholes value of each option on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Black-Scholes option-pricing model is described in Note 10 to the Consolidated Financial Statements contained in the 2016 Annual Report on Form 10-K that accompanies this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The actual number of options awarded may vary from the target level based on each NEOs individual performance evaluation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options vest in equal increments over four years and have a 10-year term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As required by the EICP, the options have an exercise price equal to the closing market price of the Common Stock on the NYSE on the date of the award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Column (f) of the 2016 Summary Compensation Table, Columns (j) through (l) of the 2016 Grants of Plan-Based Awards Table, Columns
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock Units
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we updated our long-term incentive program to include RSUs in our annual equity mix.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee sets guidelines for the value of the annual RSUs to be awarded based on competitive compensation data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These RSU awards represent approximately one-quarter of the NEOs long-term incentive compensation target award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the target number of RSUs awarded to each NEO was determined by multiplying the NEOs base salary by one-quarter of his or her target long-term incentive award percentage divided by the closing price of the Companys Common Stock on the NYSE on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The actual number of RSUs awarded may vary from the target level based on each NEOs individual performance evaluation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual RSUs vest in equal increments over three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also awards RSUs to NEOs and other executives from time to time as special incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RSUs also are awarded by the Compensation Committee to replace compensation forfeited by newly-hired executive officers and by the CEO to employees other than executive officers from the RSU pool described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2016, retention RSUs were granted to Mmes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Little, Buck and Turner, which vest in the event the recipient remains employed by the Company and/or its subsidiaries as of the third-anniversary of the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In June 2016, retention RSUs were granted to Mr. ODay, which vest in the event the recipient remains employed by the Company and/or its subsidiaries as of the one-year anniversary of the grant date.

sentences.text: Equity Pools
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To ensure flexibility in providing awards for recruitment, retention, performance recognition or in conjunction with a promotion, the Compensation Committee is authorized under the EICP to establish a stock option pool, a PSU pool, a RSU pool and a separate CEO discretionary equity pool for use by our CEO for such purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The pools are available for approximately 12 months from the date created.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determines whether to establish any or all of these pools annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options, PSUs and RSUs remaining in any pool at the end of the period do not carry over to pools established for a subsequent period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO may not make discretionary awards from any pool to the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards from the CEO pools and the CEO discretionary equity pool are made monthly according to an annually pre-determined schedule.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The exercise price for the options is based on the closing price of our Common Stock on the date of the award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Perquisites
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive perquisites are kept to a minimal level relative to a NEOs total compensation and do not play a significant role in our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The perquisites that we provide, include personal use of Company aircraft, security services for our CEO, and financial counseling and tax preparation reimbursement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See the footnotes to Column (i) of the 2016 Summary Compensation Table for information regarding the perquisites received by our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO and the other NEOs are eligible to participate in our Gift Matching Program on the same basis as other employees, retirees or their spouses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through the Gift Matching Program, we match contributions made to one or more non-profit organizations on a dollar-for-dollar basis up to a maximum aggregate contribution of $5,000 per employee annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These matching contributions are not considered compensation and are not included in Column (i) of the 2016 Summary Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEOs participate in our tax-qualified defined benefit pension plan (pension plan) and tax-qualified defined contribution 401(k) plan (401(k) plan) on the same basis as other salaried employees of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IRC regulations do not permit the Company to use base salary and other compensation paid above certain limits to determine the benefits earned by the NEOs under tax-qualified plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company maintains a defined benefit Supplemental Executive Retirement Plan (DB SERP), a defined contribution Supplemental Executive Retirement Plan (DC SERP) and a Deferred Compensation Plan to provide these and additional benefits that are comparable to those offered by our peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the provisions of the Deferred Compensation Plan, our NEOs may elect to defer payments from the DB SERP, DC SERP, OHIP, PSU and RSU awards, but not stock options or base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The DB SERP was closed to new participants in 2006.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No new participants have been or will be added to the DB SERP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEOs and other senior executives reporting to the CEO not eligible for the DB SERP are considered by the Compensation Committee for participation in the DC SERP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In comparison, the DC SERP typically yields a lower benefit than the DB SERP upon retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes that the DB SERP, DC SERP and Deferred Compensation Plan help, in the aggregate, to attract and retain executive talent, as similar plans are often components of the executive compensation programs within our Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The DC SERP was established as part of our Deferred Compensation Plan and is not a separate plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See the 2016 Pension Benefits Table and accompanying narrative and the 2016 Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation Table and accompanying narrative for more information regarding the DB SERP, DC SERP and other retirement benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employment Agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company entered into an employment agreement with Mr. Bilbrey in August 2012, which provided for Mr. Bilbreys continued employment as President and CEO and continued nomination as a member of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In November 2015, the Company and Mr. Bilbrey entered into an amendment to this employment agreement to reflect revisions to Mr. Bilbreys compensation and other benefits as a result of his election as Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The employment agreement did not have a specified term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of the employment agreement, in the event Mr. Bilbreys employment was terminated by the Company without Cause or he resigned for Good Reason (in each case as defined in the employment agreement), Mr. Bilbrey would have been entitled to certain severance benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of his termination after a change in control, Mr. Bilbrey would have been eligible to receive benefits under the Executive Benefits Protection Plan (Group 3A) (EBPP 3A).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was not entitled to an excise tax gross-up.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The employment agreement subjected Mr. Bilbrey to certain non-competition and non-solicitation covenants under the ECRCA and to compensation recovery (clawback) to the extent required by applicable law and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Bilbrey retired as our President and CEO effective March 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with his retirement, the Company and Mr. Bilbrey entered into a retirement agreement in February 2017 in order to set forth the benefits Mr. Bilbrey will receive in connection with his retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The retirement agreement supersedes and replaces Mr. Bilbreys employment agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2017, the Company entered into an employment agreement with Ms. Buck to reflect the terms and conditions of her employment as President and CEO, effective March 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms of Ms. Bucks employment agreement are substantially similar to the terms of Mr. Bilbreys employment agreement prior to the November 2015 amendment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See the section entitled Potential Payments upon Termination or Change in Control for information regarding the payments Mr. Bilbrey and Ms. Buck would have received in the event of an applicable termination o change in control occurring on December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other than as set forth above, we have not entered into employment agreements with any NEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance and Change in Control Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the NEOs are covered by our EBPP 3A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The EBPP 3A is intended to help us attract and retain executive talent and maintain a stable work environment in the event of activity that could potentially result in a Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The severance protection provided under the EBPP 3A upon a Change in Control is based upon a double trigger.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms of the plan generally provide that a covered NEO whose employment with the Company terminates in qualifying circumstances within two years after a Change in Control of the Company is entitled to certain severance payments and benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The EBPP 3A also provides severance benefits in the event of involuntary termination without Cause unrelated to a Change in Control or voluntary termination for Good Reason within two years after election of a new CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control, Cause and Good Reason are defined in the EBPP 3A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See the discussion in the section entitled Potential Payments upon Termination or Change in Control for information regarding the payments that would be due to our NEOs under the EBPP 3A in the event of an applicable termination of employment or a Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Policies and Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawbacks
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the EICP, when an individuals actions result in the filing of financial documents not in compliance with financial reporting requirements, the Company has the right to recoup or require repayment of an award earned or accrued during the twelve-month period following the first public issuance or filing with the SEC of the financial document not in compliance with such financial reporting requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Repayment or clawback occurs where the material noncompliance results from misconduct, the participants knowledge or gross negligence in engaging in the misconduct or failing to prevent the misconduct, or if the participant is one of the individuals subject to automatic forfeiture under Section 304 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Action of 2002.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2008, the Company initiated the execution of the ECRCA by executive officers as a condition for the receipt of long-term incentive awards and, for new executive officers, also as a condition of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the ECRCA is to protect the Company and further align the interests of the executive officer with those of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms of the ECRCA prohibit the executive from misusing or disclosing the Companys confidential information, competing with the Company in specific categories for a period of 12 months following separation from employment, recruiting or soliciting the Companys employees, or disparaging the Companys reputation in any way.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For those officers or employees based outside the U.S., the restrictive covenants and terms may be modified to comply with local laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Failure to comply with the provisions of the ECRCA may result in cancellation of the unvested portion of PSU and RSU awards, cancellation of any unexercised stock options and a requirement for repayment of amounts received from equity awards during the last year of employment, as well as any amounts received from the DB SERP or DC SERP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Considerations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The anticipated cost of the various components of executive compensation is also a factor in the Compensation Committees deliberations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the IRC may limit the Companys ability to deduct certain compensation in excess of $1 million paid to our CEO or to our other NEOs who are employed on the last day of the fiscal year (other than officers who served as CFO during the year).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This limitation does not apply to compensation that qualifies as performance-based under applicable Internal Revenue Service (IRS) regulations or that is paid after termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has considered the effect of Section 162(m) of the IRC on the Companys executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee exercises discretion in setting base salaries, structuring incentive compensation awards and in determining payments in relation to levels of achievement of performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that the total compensation program for NEOs should be managed in accordance with the objectives outlined in the Companys compensation philosophy and in the best overall interests of the Companys stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, compensation paid by the Company may not be deductible because such compensation exceeds the limitations, or does not meet the performance-based or other requirements, for deductibility under Section 162(m) of the IRC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 409A of the IRC specifies certain rules and limitations regarding the operation of our Deferred Compensation Plan and other retirement programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Failure to comply with these rules could subject participants in those plans and programs to additional income tax and interest penalties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our plans and programs comply with Section 409A of the IRC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that requiring NEOs and other executive officers to hold significant amounts of our Common Stock strengthens their alignment with the interest of our stockholders and promotes achievement of long-term business objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive stock ownership policy has been in place for more than 20 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews ownership requirements annually to ensure they are aligned with external market comparisons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives with stock ownership requirements have five years from their initial election to their position to accumulate and hold the minimum number of shares required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of this requirement, shares include shares of our Common Stock that are owned by the executive, unvested time-based RSUs, PSUs earned for the annual segments of open performance cycles and vested RSUs and PSUs that have been deferred by the executive as Common Stock units under our Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is anticipated that executives will hold a significant number of the shares earned from PSU and RSU awards and the exercise of stock options to satisfy their obligations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Minimum stockholding requirements for the CEO and the other NEOs are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Position     Stock Ownership Level CEO   5 times base salary COO   4 times base salary CFO and Senior Vice Presidents   3 times base salary Other executives subject to stockholding requirements   1 times base salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: he dollar value of shares which must be acquired and held equals a multiple of the individual executives base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholding requirements are updated whenever a change in base salary occurs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Failure to reach he minimum within the five-year period results in a notification letter to the executive, with a copy to the CEO, and a requirement that future stock option exercises and PSU payments be settled by retaining at least 0% of the shares of Common Stock received until the minimum ownership level is attained.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee receives an annual summary of each individual executives ownership status to monitor ompliance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Bilbrey and Ms. Buck are participants in our pension plan and are fully vested in benefits under that plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Bilbrey and Ms. Buck are also eligible to participate in our non-qualified DB SERP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No benefit is payable under the DB SERP if the executive officer terminates employment prior to age 55 or if he or she does not have five years of service with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, Mr. Bilbrey and Ms. Buck had attained age 55 with five years of service and therefore were fully vested in their respective DB SERP benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The combination of the pension and DB SERP plans was designed to provide a benefit upon retirement at or after reaching age 60 based on a joint and survivor annuity equal to 55% of final average compensation for an executive with 15 or more years of service (reduced pro rata for each year of service under 15).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective January 1, 2007, the benefit payable under the DB SERP to an executive who was age 50 or over as of January 1, 2007, was reduced by 10%, and the benefit payable to an executive who had not attained age 50 as of January 1, 2007, was reduced by 20%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the benefit payable to Mr. Bilbrey was reduced by 10% and the benefit payable to Ms. Buck was reduced by 20%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of the DB SERP, final average compensation is calculated as the sum of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the average of the highest three calendar years of base salary paid over the last five years of employment with the Company nd
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the average of the highest three OHIP awards, paid or deferred, for the last five years of employment with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefit accrued under the DB SERP is payable upon retirement (subject to the provisions of Section 409A of the IRC) as a lump sum or a life annuity with 50% benefit continuation to the participants surviving spouse, or payment may be deferred in accordance with the provisions of the Companys Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The lump sum is equal to the actuarial present value of the joint and survivor pension earned, reduced by the lump sum value of the benefits to be paid under the pension plan nd the value of the executives Social Security benefits.

sentences.text: 2016 Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation Table
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs are eligible to participate in the Companys Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Deferred Compensation Plan is a non-qualified, non-funded plan that permits participants to defer compensation that would otherwise be paid to them currently.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Deferred Compensation Plan is intended to secure the goodwill and loyalty of participants by enabling them to defer compensation when the participants deem it beneficial to do so and by providing a vehicle for the Company to make, on a non-qualified basis, contributions that could not be made on the participants behalf to the 401(k) plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company credits the Deferred Compensation Plan with a specified percentage of compensation for NEOs participating in the non-qualified DC SERP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs may elect to defer payments to be received from the DB SERP, DC SERP, OHIP, PSU and RSU awards, but not stock options or base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts deferred are fully vested and are credited to the individuals account under the Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants elect to receive payment at termination of employment or some other future date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DB SERP payments designated for deferral into the Deferred Compensation Plan are not credited as earned but are credited in full upon the participants retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payments are distributed in a lump sum or in annual installments for up to 15 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All amounts are payable in a lump sum following a Change in Control (as such terms is defined in the EICP).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All elections and payments under the Deferred Compensation Plan are subject to compliance with Section 409A of the IRC, which may limit elections and require a delay in payment of benefits in certain circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While deferred, amounts are credited with notional earnings as if they were invested by the participant in one or more investment options offered by the Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The investment options under the Deferred Compensation Plan consist of investment in a deferred common stock unit account that we value according to the performance of our Common Stock (for awards paid in stock) or in mutual funds or other investments available to participants in our 401(k) plan (for awards paid in cash).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The participants accounts under the Deferred Compensation Plan fluctuate daily, depending upon performance of the investment options elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Potential Payments upon Termination or Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain plans covering our NEOs that will require us to provide incremental compensation in the event of termination of employment or a Change in Control (as such term is defined in the applicable governing document), provided certain conditions are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following narrative takes each termination of employment situation  voluntary resignation, termination for Cause, death, disability, retirement, termination without Cause, and resignation for Good Reason  and a Change in Control of the Company, and describes the additional amounts, if any, that the Company would pay or provide to the NEOs, or their beneficiaries, as a result.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The narrative below and the amounts shown reflect certain assumptions we have made in accordance with SEC rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have assumed that the termination of employment or Change in Control occurred on December 31, 2016, and that the value of a share of our Common Stock on that day was $103.43, the closing price on the NYSE on December 30, 2016, the last trading day of 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in keeping with SEC rules, the following narrative and amounts do not include payments and benefits which are not enhanced by a qualifying termination of employment or Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vested Supplemental 401(k) Match and Supplemental CRC provided to the NEOs on the same basis as all other employees eligible for Supplemental 401(k) Match and Supplemental CRC;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vested benefits accrued under the DB SERP and account balances held under the Deferred Compensation Plan as previously described in the sections entitled 2016 Pension Benefits Table and 2 Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation Table; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options which have vested and become exercisable prior to termination of employment or Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination for Cause
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we terminate a NEOs employment for Cause, we are not obligated to pay the executive any amounts over and above vested benefits.

sentences.text: In general, a termination will be for Cause if the executive has been convicted of a felony or has engaged in gross negligence or willful misconduct in the performance of duties, material dishonesty or a material violation of Company policies, including our Code of Ethical Business Conduct, or bad faith actions in the performance of duties not in the best interests of the Company.

sentences.text: PROPOSAL NO. 3  ADVISE ON NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICER COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors unanimously recommends that stockholders ote FOR approval, on a non-binding advisory basis, of the compensat of the Companys named executive officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n accordance with the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act and related SEC rules, and as required under Section 14A of the Exchange Act, we are providing stockholders an opportunity to conduct an advisory vote regarding the compensation of our NEOs as disclosed in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to submitting your vote, we encourage you to read our Compensation Discussion & Analysis and the accompanying executive compensation tables for details about our executive compensation program, includin information about the 2016 compensation of our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed in more detail in the Compensation Discussion & Analysis, we believe our executive compensation program is competitive and governed by pay-for-performance principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We emphasize compensation opportunities that reward results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stock ownership requirements and use of stock-based incentives reinforce the alignment of the interests of our executives with those of our long-term stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In doing so, our executive compensation program supports our strategic objectives and mission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, we ask you to approve the following resolution at the Annual Meeting:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the stockholders of The Hershey Company approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation paid to the Companys named executive officers, as disclosed in the Proxy Statement for the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders pursuant to the SECs compensation disclosure rules, including the Compensation Discussion & Analysis, the Executive Compensation Tables and the related narrative discussion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because your vote is advisory, it will not be binding upon the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, as noted in the Compensation Discussion & Analysis, the Compensation Committee and the Board will, as deemed appropriate, take into account the outcome of the vote when considering future decisions affecting executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The affirmative vote of the holders of at least a majority of the shares of Common Stock and Class B Common Stock (voting together as a class) represented at the Annual Meeting, in person or by proxy, is required to approve this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL NO. 4  ADVISE ON FREQUENCY OF FUTURE ADVISORY VOTES ON NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICER COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors unanimously recommends that stockholders vote to hold future advisory votes on named executive officer compensation every 1 YEAR
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n accordance with the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act and related SEC rules, and as required under Section 14A of the Exchange Act, we are providing stockholders an opportunity to onduct an advisory vote regarding the frequency with which future advisory votes on the compensation of our NEOs should be held.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2011 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, a majority of stockholders indicated a preference for holding advisory votes on NEO compensation every year, and we have conducted such an annual vote since that time Under Section 14A of the Exchange Act, every six years we are required to provide stockholders an opportunity to again advise on the frequency with which future votes on NEO compensation should be held.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After careful consideration, the Board has determined that continuing to conduct an advisory vote on NEO compensation each year remains the most appropriate policy at this time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes such an annual vote best enables stockholders to timely express their views on the Companys executive compensation program and policies and assists the Board and the Compensation Committee in determining current stockholder sentiment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, conducting an annual advisory vote on NEO compensation is consistent with our practice of regularly seeking input from stockholders on corporate governance matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are not being asked to vote for or against this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, this proposal asks stockholders to inform us how often we should conduct an advisory vote on the compensation of our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may cast our vote by choosing the option of every 1, 2 or 3 years, or abstaining, in response to the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the option of every 1 year, 2 years or 3 years that receives the highest number of votes cast for this resolution will be determined to be the preferred frequency with which the Company is t hold future advisory votes on named executive officer compensation, as disclosed in the Companys annual proxy statement pursuant to the SECs compensation disclosure rules, including the Compensation Discussion & Analysis, the Executive Compensation Tables and the related narrative discussion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The frequency that receives the greatest number of votes from the holders of our Common Stock and Class B Common Stock voting together will be deemed to be stockholders preferred frequency for conducting future advisory votes on NEO compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because your vote is advisory, it will not be binding upon the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Board will, as it deems appropriate, take into account the outcome of the vote when determining how often the Company will conduct advisory votes on NEO compensation in future years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) of the Exchange Act requires our directors and executive officers, as well as any person who is the beneficial owner of more than 10% of our outstanding Common Stock, to file reports with the SEC and NYSE showing their ownership and changes in ownership of the Companys securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Copies of these reports also must be furnished to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on an examination of these reports and on written representations provided to us, it is our opinion that all reports for 2016 were timely filed, except for a Form 4 filed by Thomas J. Ridge on April 21, 2016 reporting the disposition of shares on March  9, 2016.
